attributes.action: Increasing humanitarian aid to Ukrainian refugees and open visa applications.
attributes.additional_details: This shows the citizens of Ukraine that they are not forgotten by the British public, and that between the trade war and actual invasion we are willing to support those who are paying the highest price standing for freedom and trying to offer better future for their children. Military aid and sanctions is not enough, although has made a difference. The families of Ukraine are carrying the spirit of defiance against aggression and it is those who need our help if they are to win an build a better future!
attributes.background: Re-open visa applications to those fleeing the conflict and increase aid to the families who have been left homeless and displaced  by the invasion

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Reopen all visa services for Ukrainians in Ukraine: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609769

Offer fast track asylum to any Ukrainians displaced due to the invasion: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609382

Waive visa requirement for Ukrainian refugees: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609530

Help Ukrainian refugees and create a safe path for them to get to the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609574

Grant Ukrainian citizens fleeing the war full rights to live and work in the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609434

Draw up and implement a specific Ukrainian refugee strategy for the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609431

On humanitarian aid, since you started your petition the Government has announced another £80 million in aid to help Ukraine deal with humanitarian crisis: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/ukraine-uk-pledges-another-80million-in-aid-to-help-ukraine-deal-with-humanitarian-crisis
